justification: Team B prioritizes consistency and possession WRs and urgently needs weekly stability; trading away Caleb Foster (their reliable slot WR) for two high-variance WRs conflicts with their preferences. The rationale focuses on Team A’s floor and mislabels Mason Mitchell as a lower-variance option. While the 2-for-2 WR swap is feasible, it’s misaligned with B’s incentives and A’s stated goal (Mitchell isn’t a floor play). Explanation is brief and not grounded in B’s context.
